poem:
Title: Debt, a Red Wheelbarrow

Much depends, 
upon the wind,
Battered, in the arms 
of the stoic sun.
In desolation's carousel,
coins fall, woefully spun -
Yet, from gnarled debt's fen,
Hope buds, yet undone.

An offering -
Two hands reach,
Invoking, a healing rain's touch,
in the shared rhythm of relief. 
Weaving respite into each gain,
unburdening the world,
grain by grain.
